function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Identifying couples based on proximity and time could lead to inaccurate assumptions about their actual relationship, potentially missing true social contacts or interactions.","Impact":"Inaccurate identification of social contacts could lead to ineffective measures for controlling the spread of infectious diseases.","Mitigation":"Consider additional contextual information or behavioral patterns to validate the nature of relationships between individuals, such as shared activities or interactions.","Technologies":"Context-aware tracking and analysis systems, video analytics with behavior recognition features.","People":"Policy makers, health authorities, disease control agencies.","Owner":"Research institutions, technology developers."},{"Description":"Enforcement of proximity-based social distancing measures may result in privacy concerns and resistance from individuals.","Impact":"Public resistance to monitoring and enforcement of social distancing measures, potential legal challenges related to privacy violations.","Mitigation":"Implement privacy-preserving data collection and analysis techniques, provide transparency about data usage and security measures, involve stakeholders in the development of privacy policies.","Technologies":"Privacy-enhanced data collection methods, decentralized data processing, encryption and anonymization techniques.","People":"General public, privacy advocates, legal experts.","Owner":"Government bodies, data protection agencies, technology developers."},{"Description":"Reliance on technology for identifying social distancing violations may lead to errors in detection and interpretation of human behaviors.","Impact":"Misidentification of social distancing violations, resulting in ineffective allocation of resources and misinformed policy decisions.","Mitigation":"Combine technology-based detection with human validation, conduct regular calibration and validation of tracking systems, provide training on interpreting results.","Technologies":"Video analytics, machine learning algorithms, human-in-the-loop validation systems.","People":"Health authorities, policy makers, data analysts.","Owner":"Technology developers, research institutions, government bodies."}]}
